body: I think this should be squashed when merged

Hi Ricardo,

The changes that we discussed will come into place when we change the schema for the existing pipelines. I changes I committed does not have any changes to schemas. It just reads the data from Hive tables/views as configured in spot.conf file instead of parquet files.

Yes, merging the change will break the spot-ml or spot-oa. As we discussed we should define use case to support reading data from hive tables/views such that I can make the changes generic to support both existing reading from parquet files as well as reading from Hive tables/views.
I gave one of my picky edit suggestions in a file toward the begging of the list of changed files. All else looks good to me:  +1

NOTE: insertInto() can't be used together with partitionBy(). As partition columns have already be defined for the 'proxy' table, it is not necessary to use partitionBy(). Verified that partitions are loaded successfully with this syntax.
What is the difference between : required ,can't be null , and the green icon ?

A couple of questions:
How do you call the SQL files to create the views?
Do you have a sample dataset to test emails,  windows events and WatchGuard events?

Hi @dgriessel 

Can you please open new a PR to replicate this change to branch1-0

Regards,
Ever
@EverLoSa replicating SPOT-212 to branch-1.0

Thanks @dgriessel 

+1
@EverLoSa can that be done a different way?

In our solution these views are created by installer. It just runs Hive and Presto binary with this file as parameter and other options (database, etc)
Yes we have (live) data for for MS Exchange, Windows (NX Log) and WatchGuard events.
If you need these data I have to get some confirmations from my side to share it here.
has this been merged?
Still needs one more +1
I merged this, but looks like a gitbot fail....
Thanks! I'll close it.
Do you have a Jira ticket created for this PR? The title must include the jira ticket..
Sorry, I didn't know the correct procedure

+1 from me
`"-kt"` is something that i think is an ok short term fix to make sure it's working as intended but i think the whole module needs some more thought.
If this PR is related to ODM, please submit this PR to ODM topic branch https://github.com/apache/incubator-spot/tree/SPOT-181_ODM
Sorry about that! I've re-targeted this PR against the SPOT-181_ODM branch.
Merging...

In an effort to provide some more visibility into the logic here, I'm attaching screenshots of the pipelines as they would be imported into the SDC. They're all parameterized, so that they can be started using filled-in variables relevant to the Spot environment.
Abandoning this PR in favor of a new one that is correctly rebased

The ASF header needs to be applied to all but `odm_setup.sh`, I'm not sure if it's acceptable to do this in a later PR. Perhaps some feedback from mentors/commiters would help there.

here's an example:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-spot/blob/2ebe57238614b6aa1162c6dc30758c516ae79273/spot-setup/create_dns_parquet.hql#L2
@natedogs911 I can make that modification.  Do we need to add the ASF header to the avro schemas as well?

@TaddWood I don't think that's possible, as JSON files do not support comments. My understanding is that avsc files would need to just be excluded from the RAT plugin that most projects use to enforce license compliance.
@jnatkins thanks for the clarification.  I'll get the ASF headers on the .sql files now and leave the avro schemas as is.
Moving request to ODM branch
merging...

Hi @TaddWood The pr is merged, but the gitbot failed and the PR is still open.
Can you close this?
@natedogs911 I need to update the json file with the dashboards.  There were some last minute modifications requested.  Would you be willing to remerge?
@natedogs911 no problem I will close the PR.  Thanks for the heads up.

Yes. Tested with 
a) Default shipped json, with gti and fb sections. Used as is without any further configuration. i.e. no gti client, or fb threatexchange creds.
b) Added in house rep service along with the above.
c) No services configured in json
d) Only in house rep service 

Can't test with other combos as I don't have fb or gti accounts.
As an added comment i think some work should be done to see if this is relevant to PR #69
Is there follow on code landing to be able to use these configurations? At least the 'free' ones like windows events? Otherwise, why have these configs here?

The JSON files are can be used by another open source project called [Data Collector](https://github.com/streamsets/datacollector) @castleguarders . The general idea behind this PR is described in the [umbrella JIRA SPOT-232](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-232) - to provide almost plug&play configuration that anyone can deploy to get started :)

Hi @mhicks-cloudera-com 

There are references to 2 images that seems to be broken, 

Line 77 --> ![image alt text](image_0.png)
LIne 3002  --> ![image alt text](image_1.png)
Merging...
@castleguarders I think we need to review the offerings and adapt the current setup scripts + documentation to properly land these. that is probably an ongoing effort.

Approving with a couple of requests,

+1
I wonder if we are worried about getting the different HQL scripts out of sync when we start adding columns and other metadata?

@jarcec I agree it could be a concern.
Is this something that can be addressed down the road?

My thoughts are,

1. Review the scripts and see if there are additional steps to bring them inline, for instance the way the hiveconf variables are being used is probably not correct and i fixed it in the beeline version.

2. would a more programmatic approach to setup (python etc) being unity to the select statements?

Oh, I absolutely think that it's something that we can deal with down the road - don't let my question stop the progress here :)

+1

Hi,
I would like to know if this PR is validated and merged to master branch?
Thanks.

Hi @anilreddydonthireddy currently all PR's require three +1's from PMC committers,
however I've recently [proposed](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/ce51f119a2246a48869871ddca5b1eb47d66622673f736845b666a2e@%3Cdev.spot.apache.org%3E) moving to a more traditional approach as this is slowing development.

we did get positive votes from that thread, so i think we need to implement the change.

EDIT: I have tested this on a kerberos cluster with success

# Test / Results
test_dateranges = [
    [2015, 9, 16, 2015, 9, 17],
    [2015, 9, 16, 2015, 10, 4],
    [2015, 1, 1, 2015, 1, 30],
    [2015, 9, 16, 2017, 12, 7],
    [2013, 9, 16, 2017, 10, 7],
    [2016, 12, 16, 2017, 10, 7],
    [2017, 8, 1, 2017, 10, 9],
]

Executing ingest_summary query                                             
            SELECT                                             
                tdate,total                                    
            FROM spot.flow_ingest_summary                       
            WHERE                                              
                (y = 2015 AND m = 9 AND d >= 16 AND d <= 17)                                             
            ORDER BY tdate                                     
            
Executing ingest_summary query                                             
            SELECT                                             
                tdate,total                                    
            FROM spot.flow_ingest_summary                       
            WHERE                                              
                (y = 2015 AND m = 9 AND d >=16) OR (y = 2015 AND m = 10 AND d <= 4 )                                             
            ORDER BY tdate                                     
            
Executing ingest_summary query                                             
            SELECT                                             
                tdate,total                                    
            FROM spot.flow_ingest_summary                       
            WHERE                                              
                (y = 2015 AND m = 1 AND d >= 1 AND d <= 30)                                             
            ORDER BY tdate                                     
            
Executing ingest_summary query                                             
            SELECT                                             
                tdate,total                                    
            FROM spot.flow_ingest_summary                       
            WHERE                                              
                (y = 2015 AND m = 9 AND d >=16)  OR (y = 2015 AND m > 9)  OR (y = 2016)  OR (y = 2017 AND m < 12)  OR (y = 2017 AND m = 12 and d <= 7)                                            
            ORDER BY tdate                                     
            
Executing ingest_summary query                                             
            SELECT                                             
                tdate,total                                    
            FROM spot.flow_ingest_summary                       
            WHERE                                              
                (y = 2013 AND m = 9 AND d >=16)  OR (y = 2013 AND m > 9)  OR (y = 2014)  OR (y = 2015)  OR (y = 2016)  OR (y = 2017 AND m < 10)  OR (y = 2017 AND m = 10 and d <= 7)                                            
            ORDER BY tdate                                     
            
Executing ingest_summary query                                             
            SELECT                                             
                tdate,total                                    
            FROM spot.flow_ingest_summary                       
            WHERE                                              
                (y = 2016 AND m = 12 AND d >=16)  OR (y = 2017 AND m < 10)  OR (y = 2017 AND m = 10 and d <= 7)                                            
            ORDER BY tdate                                     
            
Executing ingest_summary query                                             
            SELECT                                             
                tdate,total                                    
            FROM spot.flow_ingest_summary                       
            WHERE                                              
                (y = 2017 AND m = 8 AND d >=1) OR (y = 2017 AND m > 8 AND m < 10 ) OR (y = 2017 AND m = 10 AND d <= 9 )                                             
            ORDER BY tdate
+1 From my side as well :)
may I know if this pull request is merged to release branch or master branch!
having trouble with the merge, should be merging shortly

+1 from me,

@bjigmp

We made a change to the pr process,

per the new rules we only require one +1 and a period for others to review (48 hours) and give a -1 if they feel something is out of line.

I'm starting the countdown now.

+1

It would be great to fit this in with the spot-setup/odm folder but this can be done in a new PR.
We'll need to do some testing and playing to fit everything together nicely

bump @rphi 

can this be added as a parameter to spot.conf or ingest.json?

bump @anilreddydonthireddy 

what's the next step?

just a friendly note,

Per the new rules I'll give this 48 hours as a courtesy  and then merge.
